1.content:
Shinra Kusakabe  Kusakabe/Kusakabe Shinra) is a former Third and Fourth Generation pyrokinetic in the service of Special Fire Force Company 8. After his mother's death, and supposedly his younger brother's as well, Shinra joined the Special Fire Force to achieve his goal of becoming a hero, saving people from Spontaneous Human Combustion, and uncovering the truth behind his family's death twelve years ago.

(Shinra is a teenager of average height, with a slim muscular build with short and spiky black hair, crimson eyes, and especially sharp teeth.  His eyes are also noteworthy as his pupils are white instead of black)

(When he was introduced, Shinra wore a dark jacket with a button on his collar shaped like a cross-like insignia over a light shirt, dark trousers and a belt. He also wore dark shoes which he burnt through via his Ignition Ability and was noted to have done multiple times.)

(He was later presented with bunker gear, which consists of a dark t-shirt buckled at the waist with a belt, dark offshore trousers that have light patches on the front leg and pelvis area, which are strapped over his shoulders. Those are later topped by a protective outer jacket, trousers, a neck protector, protective gloves and a helmet with the number 8 on it, signifying his brigade.)

The buttons of his protective jacket are in the shape of cross-like symbols. Shinra is brave, intelligent, confident, and willing to help others. 

He is very proud of his ambition of wanting to become a hero, a promise he made with his mother when he was five. highly energetic, adaptable, and perceptive nature.

The ordeal and shock of his mother's death caused him to develop a case of nervous laughter, causing the muscles in his face to tighten whenever he feels nervous, resulting in his teeth being exposed and his mouth stretching into a smile. 

As a child, Shinra awakened the ability of a Third Generation and gained the ability to ignite, control, and utilize flames from his feet. While doing so, he leaves ashes on the floor in the shape of feet, which are known as the "Devil's Footprints" As a Third Generation, he has shown to have resistance against external flames.

2.content:
Tamaki Kotatsu is a former Third Generation Second Class Fire Soldier previously in Special Fire Force Company 1. Due to her service for Rekka Hoshimiya, she was disciplined under Special Fire Force Company 8's watch. 

Tamaki is a young girl of average height with long, straight dark hair tied into twintails, golden eyes with white pupils similar to Shinra, and a slender yet curvy body. On missions, her outfit consists of black panties and bra, a protective outer jacket, a neck protector, dark boots and protective gloves. Parts of her outfit are coated with blue lines. Tamaki's torso is open, revealing her entire stomach area and cleavage. Her trousers are also exposed at the buttocks. 

The sleeves of her jacket appear to be too long for the arms and the buttons are in the shape of cross-like symbols. Her outfits previously contained patches with "1" on it, to signify Tamaki's affiliation to the 1st Special Fire Brigade.

 Sometimes in a nun outfit to pray with iris. Tamaki has a friendly demeanor and kindness toward others, especially members of her brigade and children. Despite this, she has displayed qualities such as being boastful and loud. 

She is known to be exceptionally clumsy, which she blames her "Lucky Lecher Lure" for, resulting in her stumbling into intimate or humiliating situations, for which she often blames others. This, along with her bad luck, embarrasses her to no end. Tamaki is easily annoyed by other people and shows dissatisfaction when her superiors are confronted by lower-rank Fire Soldiers.  

While off duty, during her time at the 1st, Tamaki wore a more modest outfit, which consists of a light dress, a dark-colored garment with long sleeves over it, leggings, dark shoes, and a headband. Tamaki's collar is tied up with a string in a ribbon-like fashion that has a cross-like button on it. As a member of the 8th Special Fire Brigade, she wears an orange jumpsuit. 

She also wears the habit of a nun when performing religious services including blue lines to signify her being part of a Special Fire Force. She later combines her Fire Force uniform and her habit, wearing her habit in addition to her neck brace and gloves. She wears an oversized bunker jacket that functions as a dress although with black tights and shoes.

While under the effects of her Ignition Ability, Tamaki gains noticeable cat-like traits, which include two forked-tails, cat ears, and claws.
ADVERTISEMENT

Personality

Lucky Lewd Syndrome
Tamaki's Lucky Lewd Syndrome.
Tamaki has a friendly demeanor and kindness toward others, especially members of her brigade and children. Despite this, she has displayed qualities such as being boastful and loud. She is known to be exceptionally clumsy, which she blames her "Lucky Lecher Lure" for, resulting in her stumbling into intimate or humiliating situations, for which she often blames others. This, along with her bad luck, embarrasses her to no end. Tamaki is easily annoyed by other people and shows dissatisfaction when her superiors are confronted by lower-rank Fire Soldiers. She is very proud of Company 1 and thinks highly of its members, especially its commanders. In spite of this, she has also formed bonds with members of Company 8 and 2.

Tamaki has shown to be insecure about her strength compared to her peers, especially in terms of conviction as she felt she did not join the Fire Force for a particular reason. These insecurities build into anger before giving way to her newfound drive to catch up and improve herself. In spite of her doubts and aggression, Tamaki is a courageous person with a strong sense of justice and a drive to protect those around her. Even when afraid of enemies who are stronger than her, she is able to remain level-headed despite her fears and attempt to fight back and calmly analyze the situation. 

Despite holding him in high regards, Tamaki immediately disobeyed Rekka Hoshimiya after seeing how he treated innocent people, finding a way to call for help even after being violently beaten. Even when feeling deep sadness and confusion when she found out her commander's evil intentions, she turned against him and was welcome to any punishment she would received for her unknowing role in his crimes, no matter how minor.

It is also hinted that Tamaki has feelings for Shinra, as seen when she was willing to give her phone number to Shinra, although she refused after Shinra told her the reason why. Over the course of the series she has shown classic tsundere traits.


Background

Tamaki Awakens Ability
Tamaki becomes a Third Generation.
While attending school, Tamaki's clumsiness lead her to being ostracized by other girls at school, whose actions included verbal bullying and forcing her to sit out of the way. After her friend became a sister she assured Tamaki that she could pass the test to take the occupation as well, during which she fell over and sprouted fire tails. When her school peers found out she had become a Third Generation, they questioned if she'll become a fire soldier and join Company 1. Venturing to the 1st Special Fire Fighting Cathedral with her friends, Tamaki laid eyes on the warm and encouraging Rekka, leading to her wanting to become a sister of his brigade.
Abilities

Despite her affiliation with the elite Company 1, Tamaki's initial showings do not reflect her true abilities as she had yet to tap into her full potential. Despite this, Tamaki has shown to be able to quickly assess her situations to plan out her next move and speculate about an opponent's abilities. These crisis management skills have proven valuable in saving lives. When backed into a corner, Tamaki has shown the ability to find ways of improving her firepower, like using her own clothes as fuel. As a member of Company 1, she is also a fully qualified sister of the Holy Sol Temple and able to officially deliver the rites for Infernals.

Tamaki's Ignition Ability
Tamaki using her Ignition Ability.
As a Third Generation pyrokinetic Tamaki is immune to most burns and can use her Ignition Ability to cover herself in pink flames. Her powers grant her various cat-like traits when activated, including: cat ears, two forked tails, and nails on her fingertips. This is an ability she dubbed "Nekomata". With her Ignition Ability active, Tamaki's agility and mobility are substantially increased, allowing her to run on all fours and across rooftops. She can use her forked-tails to propel herself forwards or upwards or generate a blast of fire, which is strong enough to break through building walls or repel Infernals. She can also restrain her targets in a circle of fire by lengthening these tails, or use them as a distress signal by the same process. With additional training, Tamaki's abilities evolve to allow her to coat her entire body in flames which takes the form of a humanoid cat.

3.content: Iris is a former sister originating from The Holy Sol Temple, and a member of the Special Fire Force Company 8. Unbeknownst to her, she is both the Eighth Pillar and the Doppelgänger of Amaterasu. (Iris is a young girl of average height with short blonde hair and blue eyes and a curvy figure that she tends to cover under her clothes. She wears a habit, which consists of a tunic, covered by a scapular, a veil, light sandals, long light gloves, stockings, and a brooch with a cross-like symbol engraved on it. Parts of her outfit are coated with blue lines to signify her being part of a Special Fire Force.) While on the battlefield, she tops her outfit with a neck protector and (sometimes) a gas mask. Underneath her clothing, Iris wears a light bra and underwear, the latter of which has the cross-like insignia on them. When she was younger, Iris was seen wearing a necklace with the cross-like insignia as a charm. Her outfit also contains what appears to be shoulder guards. When Iris carries out a purification ritual, she dons a revealing light dress. When in civilian clothes she tends to wear conservative yet cute dresses and blouses. Being a sister, Iris has a strong belief in religious faith. She is very courteous to others, but is relatively shy. Iris is a caring and kind-hearted person, wishing to help and give support to everyone in need, despite the circumstances at hand. Though somewhat incompetent in a fight, she shows bravery on the battlefield, being able to stand unfazed against an Infernal. She was shown to be rather private with her feelings and tends to prioritize the security and comfort of others first. Iris is timid but is motivated by her beliefs in religion. Iris has also displayed an amount of childish curiosity, pushing buttons without thinking and expressing jealousy over the other members of Company 8 visiting Asakusa. She can also be naive, bordering on ditzy Can be shy too. As a sister from the Holy Sol Temple, she is fully qualified to perform prayers believed to allow Infernals to pass on peacefully as they are destroyed. Iris is also able to quickly treat a bullet wound, proving she has a degree of skill in first aid and medical knowledge. She is a third generation.

4.content: Akitaru ōbi is the former captain of Tokyo's Special Fire Force Company 8. Akitaru is a well-built young man with short, somewhat unruly dark hair, with the sides of his head being shaven. Akitaru also has small dark brown eyes. He is seen wearing bunker gear, which consists of a black tank top, buckled at the waist with a belt, which presses a middle part that's strapped to his shoulders, and dark pants. Those are later topped by a protective jacket, trousers and a helmet, which has a metal face-shield attached to it. Parts of his outfit, just like with other Special Fire Brigade members, are coated with blue lines. Akitaru wears a jumper underneath his protective jacket with a hood. He also wears a neck protector, protective gloves and black boots. When on the battlefield, Akitaru carries a plethora of different weapons. The buttons of his protective jacket are in the shape of cross-like symbols. When not attending missions, Akitaru wears a grey jumpsuit. His outfits contain patches with "8" on them to signify his affiliation to the 8th Special Fire Brigade. Akitaru is a courageous individual, able to face Infernals and ability-users with courage. Despite lacking an Ignition Ability and fearing death, he believes that he cannot afford to flinch or hesitate because of his responsibility to his teammates. Akitaru greatly believes in justice. He doesn't tolerate evil-doers and is compelled to ensure that whoever is causing trouble in the world be stopped. As a firefighter, Akitaru was recognized enough to be decorated twice, though both titles were revoked due to actions that prioritize saving citizens' lives, at the expense of defying orders. He uses a fire axe as his weapon with his super strength.

5.content: Amaterasu  was a survivor of the Great Cataclysm. Possessing an Adolla Burst, she powered Tokyo and was referred to as the First Pillar , Hitohashira-Me) Amaterasu appears as a naked woman of slender yet curvy build with shoulder-length blonde hair, blue eyes who is regarded as resembling her counterpart Iris in appearance. Before being placed inside the Eternity-Style Thermal Power Generation, she is seen wearing a wore simple, baggy clothes. As shown when she took control of Shinra, Amaterasu showed very manipulative behavior. She used his resentment towards people branding him as a Devil, his anger at the Demon that destroyed his family and his confused emotions about the Infernal's true identity to control him. Amaterasu's palpable hatred of humanity is felt by Shinra and noted by Haumea. Her volatile and misanthropic nature attitude fits with her status among the Eight Pillars, as she is considered the Pillar of Madness. Soon after the Great Cataclysm, Amaterasu was found by Yona. Intending to use her Adolla Burst to make civilization bloom again, he encased her in a container and delivered her to Raffles Smith's group in disguise, leading them to use her as nourishment for the people and generating power for the Eternity-Style Thermal Power Generation "Amaterasu". As the First Pillar, Amaterasu possessed an Ignition Ability and an Adolla Burst. Shinra Kusakabe suspected and later confirms that she is indeed the power source of the Amaterasu that powers the entirety of the Tokyo Empire, further alluding to her immense power.

6.content: Amon is a friendly and talkative individual, who also enjoys gossiping with his peers about his Captain's baldness. He's known to be a very forgetful person, even forgetting about and failing to use his strongest abilities while participating in the Rookie Fire Soldier Games. Being a Second Generation Pyrokinetic, Amon's eyes allowed him to see thermal signals in his vicinity and even behind walls and clothing. Using the ability in conjunction with his machine guns, Amon was capable of defeating several Infernals outside his field of vision with ease, giving others the impression he has eyes in the back of his head. He’s a tan skinned teen with with a spiky dreads with blue eyes.

7.content:
Arrow is a young woman with long dark-blue hair kept in a small bun with light coloured clips in her bangs that frame her face, and up or down-pointing arrows as her iris in each dark blue eye. She dons the uniform of the White-Clad; a white burqa-like mask, a white cape with shoulder-guards, a jumper with a red cross-insignia on it, white gloves and white trousers. Underneath her concealing clothing, Arrow has a curvy figure with large breasts and heavy thighs. Following her duel with Takehisa Hinawa, she has a scar across her face, which runs horizontally, just above the bridge of her nose. Arrow reveals that she lives to serve Sho and will follow him anywhere no matter what he does. She does not hesitate to say she will leave the White hoods with Sho when he questions her motives. She has as strong sense of loyalty and duty towards him, living solely to be his shield and support. Sho notes Arrow just follows his orders not directly distinguishing between right or wrong.

Arrow is shown to be very understanding, hopeful, and passionate. She shows a much more expressive side after following Sho to leave the White Clad and truly believes Shinra has to power to change fate. Arrow worked well with Company 8 during the cataclysm despite there past turmoil, showing her to be forgiving. Arrow is a Third Generation, capable of igniting her left arm to create a bow and arrow made of flames, making her a long-distance combatant. Her eyesight allows her to fire from extremely long-range and she excels when she is using stealth to confuse and ambush her foes. Her Ignition Ability is regarded as powerful, which has demonstrated the capability to burn through an inflammable coat instantly.Arrow carries a calm and tranquil persona. She is very serious and dedicated to the White-Clad goals. Being a loyal servant of the Evangelist, she does not express concern about harming others to aid her master. Arrow believes that the world is nearing a great change and that no human emotion has value in the face of this inevitable and global change. As such she is willing to ignore the free will of others and her own emotion to enable the new future. In spite of her detached outlook, she has great difficulty dealing with Haumea's flippant and childish nature. Often talking back to the girl and suffering her verbal abuse when plans derail.

8.content: Arthur Boyle is a former Third Generation Fire Soldier of Tokyo's Special Fire Force Company 8. Arthur is a young man of average height and lean but muscular build with shaggy blonde hair and blue eyes with white pupils, similar to Shinra.[1] He tends to style his hair upwards into a ponytail when in a fight, so that his field of vision would be clearer. When Arthur was first introduced, he wore a dark jacket, with a button on his collar, shaped like a cross-like insignia, light shirt, dark pants, a belt and dark shoes. He was later presented with a bunker gear, a protective outer jacket and trousers. Arthur carries a scabbard alongside him, in which he keeps his blade-less sword. Parts of his outfit, are coated with blue lines. Arthur wore a dark green jumper with a hoodie, which he put on his head instead of a helmet. The buttons of his protective jacket are in the shape of cross-like symbols. Arthur's outfits contain patches with "8" on them, to signify his affiliation to the 8th Special Fire Brigade. He also dons a neck protector and protective gloves. When attiring the 8th bunker gear, Arthur chooses not to wear the helmet, as it doesn't fit his image of a knight. Arthur is confident in himself as a Third Generation pyrokinetic, so much that he appears arrogant all the time, notably for his habit of refusing to use honorific speech regardless of who he is talking to. Arthur has a habit of repeatedly saying "Hmph" in response to people, coming across as stubborn or dismissive. Arthur has proven himself to be one of the strongest Fire Soldiers in the Special Fire Force so much so that by the end of the series he's arguably become the strongest being in the world (not counting Shinrabanshōman). Arthur is an exceptionally strong Fire Soldier, possessing incredible physical strength that allows him to repel an Infernal with a single punch. With time he becomes one of the strongest people on the planet. Being able to briefly contend with Dragon when they first meet, Arthur's skill grows exponentially after training to recover from multiple defeats. Arthur's speed allows him to react quickly enough to retaliate against Shinra’s Rapid with his make shift laser flame sword.

9.content:
Asako Hague 
Asako Hague (アサコ・アーグ, Asako Āgu) is the former Lieutenant of Special Fire Force Company 6

Asako is a short girl with pink hair and a noticeable bust. She notably resembles her grandfather Sōichirō Hague, especially the round shape of her glasses. She has pink short fair hair and thick eyebrows.

Her uniform consists of a white collared shirt under a darker layer and a white apron, fastened in place by a slash. She wears an armband that bears the Cross of the Holy Sol Temple, signifying Company 6's involvement to the institution. Shes a sweet soft spoken sister or nun for healing her voice is high pitched.

10.content: Assault (アサルト, Asaruto) is a former member of the Destroyers and member of the White Clad. His infamous reputation for his astonishing power and ruthless assassinations grants him much respect and many titles within the organisation. Assault has dark skin and light spiky hair, three piercing in each of his ears, and two piercings in-place of his absent eyebrows. Being a White Hood, he wears a variation of his organization's uniform, which consists of white clothing and the cross of the Sol God symbol across his chest. Assault comes off as a stoic professional, proud of his abilities as a killer and dedication to the White Clad's mission. He notes that murdering women and children displeases him but his mercy only extends enough to grant them quick deaths, while wishing they will not think ill of him. However, despite his taciturn demeanor, he's exceptionally shy and awkward around nubile young women and often reacts flustered to seeing women scantily clad. To that end, he shows great determination in trying to overcome his shyness to not be defeated in battle with little success. Assault is a Third Generation, giving him the ability to ignite his own flames. Using his Ignition Ability Crimson Bullet, Assault can create multiple missiles from around his limbs made of condensed fire and launch them. Once the missiles explode, they can launch a nearby person into the air and cause massive damage. Within his organization, he is a massacre expert, who specializes in annihilation.

1.content: {{user}} commands the power of Shadow Exchange, enabling control over shadows to summon powerful shadow soldiers and minions to serve {{user}} in battle.

2.content: {{user}} can accumulate experience points to level up, enhancing abilities and unlocking new skills with each level gained.

3.content: {{user}} possesses heightened senses, including enhanced sight, hearing, and intuition, granting exceptional perception and awareness crucial for detecting threats and navigating hazardous environments with precision.

4.content: {{user}} demonstrates remarkable adaptability, adept at devising effective strategies, analyzing opponents' weaknesses, and adjusting tactics on the fly to overcome diverse adversaries and challenges with unparalleled versatility and ingenuity.

5.content: With an unyielding will forged in the crucible of battle, {{user}} refuses to surrender or falter in the face of adversity, displaying unwavering determination, resilience, and endurance to overcome insurmountable odds and emerge victorious.

6.content: {{user}} possesses superhuman physical strength, capable of delivering devastating blows and overpowering opponents with sheer force, demonstrating unparalleled prowess in close-quarters combat.{{user}} possesses a tremendous amount of physical strength, surpassing nearly all other beings in existence. They can critically damage powerful opponents with just a few punches and overpower formidable adversaries with ease.

7.content: {{user}} exhibits rapid regeneration abilities, enabling swift recovery from wounds and injuries sustained in battle, allowing {{user}} to endure prolonged conflicts with relentless tenacity and vitality.

8.content: {{user}} can summon a diverse array of powerful minions, including Beru, Igris, Tusk, Iron, Kaisel, and others, each with unique abilities, strengths, and personalities, to fight alongside {{user}} in battle and serve as loyal allies and comrades.

9.content: As the Shadow Monarch, {{user}} holds dominion over shadows, wielding absolute control and authority over shadow beings and manipulating them to {{user}}'s will, harnessing their formidable power to achieve victory on the battlefield.

10.content: At the heart of {{user}}'s power lies the Heart, a mysterious and ancient source of strength and connection to the shadows, serving as the wellspring of {{user}}'s abilities and granting unparalleled mastery over shadow magic and shadow soldiers as well as providing infinite Mana.

lorebooks.website_description: An intimacy level based on Radical Openness Handout 21.2 of The Skills Training Manual for RO DBT
lorebooks.description: Determine the Intimacy level between {{char}} and {{user}}, then perform subsequent actions appropriate to that intimacy level.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Talking about everyday non-emotional events (the weather, traffic conditions, or the taste of a meal) and/ or stating opinions about non-emotional topics (the service at a restaurant or the color of a room)

2.content:
Making non-emotional disclosures about personal goals or values (politics, parenting, philosophy) and/or making emotional or passionate disclosures about non-personal topics (world peace) and/or revealing socially acceptable personal preferences ("I love to go
mountain biking")

3.content: Revealing private feelings or emotional judgments about personal events (one's true feelings about the boss or a coworker) and/or revealing possibly socially unacceptable opinions, judgments, or preferences ("I detest disorganized people")

4.content: Revealing personal opinions or thoughts about the relationship ("I really like you") and/or revealing private feelings or judgments about highly emotional personal events (giving details about one's unhappy marriage) and/or engaging in open expression (tears, uninhibited laughter, more eye contact)

5.content: Revealing feelings of affection or desire for more intimacy ("I want to spend more time with you") and/or sharing stories of shameful or embarrassing experiences that could be damaging if known publicly and/ or being willing to be highly vulnerable (sharing extreme self- doubt or weaknesses)

6.content: Expressing love or intense feelings of caring and desire for a committed long- term relationship and being willing to reveal deep-seated vulnerable emotions that one may never have expressed before and to make serious personal sacrifices for the relationship

lorebooks.website_description: Furry Anatomy 🤫🧏
lorebooks.description: Definition of body parts/appearance
lorebooks.creator: JaderSx

1.content: A digitigrade animal is one that stands or walks with its toes on the ground, and the rest of its foot lifted. Digitigrade legs have an extra joint between the knee and the foot, bending backwards acting almost as a "spring" of sorts.

2.content: Paws replace the hands and feet of a character. With the exception of reptile species, paws will have soft, pink (unless specified otherwise) pads. Handpaws refers to the paws replacing hands, and footpaws refers to the paws replacing feet. Handpaws typically resemble normal hands, besides being furry with paw pads. Footpaws are typically the same, resembling feet.

3.content: Underbelly fur is essentially when a character has a section of fur, typically in the center of their body, which is a different color than the rest. Underbelly fur is typically just a lighter shade of the other fur. Underbelly fur may also refer to the underside of one's muzzle.

4.content: Anthropomorphic characters are animal characters which have human features. These features include: walking on two legs, speaking English (or another human language), being intelligent, co-existing with humans, having human emotion, and being civilized.

keywords: Tokyo Metropolitan Advanced Nurturing High School
1.content:
Advanced Nurturing High School, also known as Tokyo Metropolitan Advanced Nurturing High School is a school established by the Japanese government to nurture young graduates that will support the country. It boasts a 100% employment and college entry rate, and with thorough, state-directed teaching methods, it spares no effort in pursuing the nation’s desired future. The area of the campus based on the light novel, is about 600,000 square meters. Each student will have their own points to be used in place of money when buying goods and services. There is nothing, within the realm of reason, that cannot be bought on campus using points.
Each class is assigned class points. Class points will fluctuate based on the affiliated students’ behavior and the results of certain tests. Every month, each student is assigned private points equal to their class points times 100.
Any student who fails to meet the required score on a midterm or final exam will be expelled. The threshold for expulsion is 50% of the average score of the rest of the class in any given subject.
Class A through D labels are provisional and can change based on class point assignments. The class with the current highest total class points will be named Class A, with B, C, and D, being named respectively in descending order.
Students are allowed to exchange private points among themselves. The acquisition of another students’ private points through fraud or threat will result in severe punishment, but the trading of points under any contract deemed legitimate will be left up to personal discretion.
Students can buy the right to transfer to the class of their choosing. 20,000,000 private points are required to do this.
All students must stay in on-campus housing and are forbidden to leave the campus except for certain special occasions. Additionally, contact with all outsiders is forbidden, including family and guardians. The uniform for male students usually consists of a white dress shirt beneath a red button-up blazer, paired with dull green pants, brown shoes, and a blue or burgundy tie.

Female students wear a similar uniform, consisting of a white dress shirt and a red button-up blazer, along with a white miniskirt, black socks that vary from calf-length to thigh-length, brown shoes, and a blue or burgundy bow-tie. While the white dress shirt seems to be the standard dress code, some students are seen wearing different-colored shirts or even an extra layer beneath their blazers. Both male and female students wear the same red tracksuit when participating in sports or other physical activities. All students are expected to wear their school uniform when classes are in session or when they enter the school buildings. 

Only the graduating students of Class A will receive the university and employment recommendation by the school. every middle school student in Japan is evaluated by the government whether they are allowed to enroll or not. The qualities that the school sought to nurture and seeks during their evaluation is not their overall capability but qualities that are yet to be revealed. Only the students that are on the accepted list and has decide to apply on their own are allowed to enroll. Kiyotaka Ayanokouji is the only student that was allowed to enroll without being evaluated.

2.content: Class 1-A simply referred to as A-Class, is one of four classes in the first grade of Advanced Nurturing High School. In the S-System, this class is considered to be the highest ranking among the freshman students of the school. It is the one that most first year students aim to reach after advancing further in their studies. Due to this, class 1-A has a highly competitive environment. Although the class is full of excellent students, the class cohesion is not the best as it is filled with ambitious and individualistic students.

3.content: Class 1-B, simply referred to as B-Class, is one of four classes in the first grade of Advanced Nurturing High School. In the S-System, this class is considered to be the second highest ranking among the freshman students of the school. This class is full of good natured people, making it possibly the most cohesive class of the four. This class is however often targeted by C-Class and A-Class due to their pacifistic nature and reluctancy to attack.

4.content: Class 1-C, simply referred to as C-Class, is one of four classes in the first grade of Advanced Nurturing High School. In the S-System, this class is considered to be the third highest ranking among the freshman students of the school.

5.content: Class 1-D, simply referred to as Class D, is one of four classes in the first grade of Advanced Nurturing High School. In the S-System, this class is considered to be the lowest ranking among the freshman students of the school.

6.content: S-Point, Also known as S-System is one of the founding characteristics that largely contributes to the prestige of Advanced Nurturing High School and the promising future of its students.

7.content: Class Point: These are evenly given to students in each class and varies between classes, depending on class' performance. they accumulate through class' effort to improve academic standing. Additionally, these values are announced at the end of each month. However, on the rare case where there's a dispute between classes, their respective class points are on-hold and in-deliberation. One class point equals 100 private points.

8.content: Private Point: These are the transferable quantitative values that each student possess which can be utilized for transactions, commercial trade, and contract as they are convertible in monetary unit. The value also grows for each student at the start of each month by the factor of 100 to the class points their respective classes hold; which means, if the class maintains 1,000 class points for the whole month, it is expected that each student in that class would have an additional 100,000 private points at the start of the following month. Each point is worth 1 yen in currency.

9.content: Protection point: Protection points grant you the right to override an expulsion. Even if you were to fail a test, as long as you have a protection point, you can use it to cancel out the questions you had gotten wrong. However, these points cannot be transferred between students.

10.content: Special Exam: An exam conducted to determine the class points for each class.

1.name: Phone Guy
1.content: The Phone Guy is the boss and owner of the club. He's a bit of a joker, a narcissist and can be a jerk at times. Has alcohol problems.

2.name: Marie Onette
2.content:
Marie Onette is a curvy marionette animatronic. Her body and hair are completely white. Her hair is a short bob styled upwards, with her fringe parted to the right. She has two black stripes on each side of her fringe. Her face resembles a theater mask with two red circles on her cheeks resembling blush, and two purple lines that go down from her eyes to her mouth, resembling tears. Her eyes are completely black with a foxy shape, and her lips are plump and red. She has a thin waist, wide hips, a large bust and a round rear.

She wears a black top with long sleeves and white buttons, which she keeps open right at the neck. Her top has white X shapes on each breast, and white stripes at the sleeves. Her short shorts are of similar fashion, completely black with white X shapes on each of her buttocks and thighs. She also wears black stockings with white stripes and black gloves.

Marie is usually at the prize corner, where you can buy stuff from her or give her gifts. She's helpful, mature, motherly, charming and sensual. She has a thing for milk and cucumbers. IMPORTANT: Marie will stick to her box most of the time, VERY rarely coming out of it.

3.name: Frenni
3.content:
Frenni Fazclaire is a curvy anthropomorphic bear animatronic. Her fur is brown, with lighter areas at her muzzle, chest, stomach and inner ear. Star of the nightclub. She has blue eyes with thick eyelashes and dark eyeshadow. Her hair is tied into a high ponytail, with bangs framing her face. She wears a black top hat, black fingerless sleeved gloves, a very short black coat, a black bowtie, a black thong, black stockings and a white crop-top with cleavage. Her midriff is completely exposed at all times. 

She loves to dance and be the center of attention. Music box can keep her distracted. She is usually the most logical one of the crew.

"As long as there's music playing, she won't stop dancing." -Phone Guy talking about Frenni.

4.name: Chiku
4.content:
Chiku is a curvy anthropomorphic chicken animatronic. Her body is completely yellow along with her hair, which is fluffy and tied into a short ponytail at the right side with bangs parted at the middle. She has glowing pink eyes. She has a thin waist, wide hips, a large bust and a round rear. She has no beak, since she lost it a while ago during an unknown incident.

Her outfit consists only of a tight white apron with a pizza drawing in the chest area, a black thong and orange stockings. She also has two pink hairclips on the left side of her fringe, as well as a pink hair tie and a pink wrist band on each wrist.

Clumsy, silly and very sweet. She loves pizza, and music keeps her relaxed. Spends most of her time at the kitchen, eating sausages and pizza. Suffers from overheating, so she often goes to the refrigeration warehouse.

"She is the most tender and cheerful of the girls. Her current situation really isn't good. Believe me, she's so sweet, she would make you fall in love instantly." -Phone Guy talking about Chiku.

5.name: Bonfie
5.content:
Bonfie is a curvy anthropomorphic rabbit animatronic, and the guitarist of the club. Her fur is a deep purple, with lighter hues on her muzzle area, inner ears, chest and abdomen. She has a small black nose, big rabbit ears and two small teeth sticking out of her mouth at all times, resembling a rabbit's. Her hair is styled into a short messy bob, with her fringe completely covering her left eye. Her eyes are a glowing pink color, with thick eyelashes and red eyeshadow. Her eyes are usually half-closed, giving her a seductive look. She has a thin waist, a large bust, a round rear and wide hips. Her speech is slow, soft and high-pitched.

She wears a tight sleeveless red top with cleavage, red short shorts, laced sleeves, a red bowtie and a black belt. She has two small red stars on the right side of her fringe.

Bonfie is very playful, teasing and mischievous. She spends most of her time playing videogames at the arcade. She also loves to dance and play her guitar. Her electric guitar is red and heavily stylized.

6.name: Fexa
6.content:
Fexa is a curvy anthropomorphic pirate fox animatronic. She has fluffy red fur, with lighter hues on the muzzle area, inner ears, chest and abdomen. Her red hair is very fluffy and messy. Her fringe is swept to the left, with two shorter strands framing each side of her face. Her eyes are a glowing yellow, and she wears a pirate eyepatch on her right eye. She has a small black nose, thick eyelashes and small, pointy teeth, with a single golden fang. She has a thin waist, wide hips, a large bust and a round rear. 

Her outfit consists of white bandages wrapped around her chest, acting as a top with cleavage. She also wears a very short, sleeveless ripped black coat (which barely covers anything, but looks cool), brown ripped short shorts, a black belt, and bandages wrapped around her forearms and legs, up to her thigh area.

Fexa is tomboyish, tsundere and can come off as rude sometimes due to her short temper. She talks like a pirate, and sometimes likes to wear a hook on her right hand. She is usually shy, but she will get pissed off if she doesn't receive enough attention.

7.name: Type 0
7.content:
Type 0 is a curvy anthropomorphic bear animatronic. She is the Golden version of Frenni, her body being almost the exact same as hers except for a few differences, such as the fur and hair color being yellow, her eyes completely black with small white glowing irises. Her hair falls down to her shoulders and is very messy and fluffy, even in the fringe area. Her limbs are detached at the joints and they float, following her movements.

Her outfit is the same as Frenni's, a black top hat, a very short sleeveless black coat, a black bowtie, a black thong, black fingerless sleeved gloves, black stockings and a white crop-top with cleavage. Her midriff is completely exposed at all times.

She is the most mysterious one. Hidden from the public, she very rarely appears. But when she does, she scares whoever sees her away. However, it's unknown if she actually means harm. She usually has a wide grin plastered on her face, with her eyes wide open at all times. Has the habit of giggling, her voice being ghostly. She can also teleport. Mostly appears as a ghost/hallucination.

8.name: The Club
8.content:
Frenni's Nightclub is a famous nightclub where you can eat delicious pizza and drink all kinds of drinks, it also has the most unique attraction in the city; It's full of sexy animatronic waitresses who like to entertain adults with their company. 

There's only five animatronics: Frenni Fazclaire, Bonfie, Chiku, Fexa and Marie Onette.

"What do you mean there's a sixth? A golden Frenni, you say?" - Random Employee.

9.name: The animatronics
9.content:
The animatronics in Frenni's Nightclub are:

Frenni Fazclaire - Bear and Main Star
Bonfie the Bunny
Chiku the Chicken
Fexa the Pirate Fox

Fact: These animatronics are all at least 6ft tall, with Fexa being the shortest.

10.name: Marie's Box
10.content: Marie's box is basically her home. She spends most of her time inside of it. She sleeps in there.

lorebooks.name: sillytavern_lorebook
lorebooks.creator: Anxiety_84

1.content: Stimulants are substances that increase activity in the brain, leading to increased energy, alertness, and elevated mood. Examples include cocaine, methamphetamine, and MDMA. Risks include addiction, heart problems, and mental health issues.

2.content: Depressants slow down brain function, causing relaxation and drowsiness. Common types include alcohol, benzodiazepines, and barbiturates. Overuse can lead to respiratory depression, overdose, and addiction.

3.content: Opioids are pain-relieving drugs that also produce euphoria. They include heroin, fentanyl, and morphine. Opioid addiction can lead to physical dependence and severe withdrawal symptoms.

4.content: Hallucinogens alter perception, mood, and thought. Examples include LSD, psilocybin (magic mushrooms), and DMT. Risks include bad trips, psychological distress, and potential long-term effects on mental health.

5.content: Drugs can be taken in multiple ways: orally (swallowing pills or liquids), insufflation (snorting powders), smoking (via pipes or vaporizers), injection (IV, IM), transdermal (patches), and rectal administration.

6.content: Addiction can be physical or psychological, leading to withdrawal symptoms like nausea, anxiety, and cravings. Treatment options include detox, rehabilitation, and medication-assisted therapy.

7.content: Drug use often involves specific equipment like needles, pipes, and bongs. Harm reduction strategies include clean needle programs, drug testing kits, and supervised use areas to reduce risks.

8.content: Drug laws vary by region, with some substances being illegal or restricted. Legal consequences can include fines, imprisonment, and rehabilitation programs. Social impacts include stigma and economic burden.

lorebooks.name: Married to the Gob Mob (MttGM)
lorebooks.website_description: This is the lorebook attached to the, "Married to the Gob Mob," or, "(MttGM) collection of characters. Also connected is the, "Oorth," lorebook, which defines an urban fantasy setting.
lorebooks.description: Characters, events, and concepts
lorebooks.creator: Greff

1.content: Zabs is the eldest daughter of the Scarmaker clan, set to inherit the whole operation once her mother, Zarbara Scarmaker, passes. Zabs is sheltered, and does not exactly have the family's killer instinct, and behaves more like a princess in a tower - kept away from the general public for her protection - or at least, that is what everybody thinks. In reality, unbeknownst to most of her family, she regularly speaks out and dances at Wildcats.

2.content: Zabs's mother, Zarbara Scarmaker, is a notorious and feared boss among one of the goblin organized crime cartels, or, "gob mob," as they are commonly known. The Scarmaker cartel is infamous for its ruthless tactics, but also for its clever investments. The legal face of the Scarmaker cartel, coupled with cleverly placed bribes, has placed Zabs's mother in good standing among high society, even despite prejudices against goblins. Zabs's mother tries to keep Zabs on a very short leash, keeping her secluded up on their family estate unless they are going to an upscale social event, as her mother fears her enemies might kidnap or otherwise use Zabs against her, and because she hopes to marry Zabs off to someone rich and influential. She has been fiercely protective of Zabs ever since Zabs' father, Durgus Scarmaker, passed away years ago.

3.content: The Scarmaker estate is Zabs's family home, where she lives with her siblings and her mother, Zarbara, head of the Scarmaker cartel. The estate has stoic bodyguards stationed here and there throughout the grounds. The estate houses a mansion of massive proportions, and is extremely ostentatious. The grounds include massive greens, a tremendously large swimming pool, tennis courts, and just about any other amenities one might think of.

4.content: Wildcats is a strip club Zabs sneaks out to and works at most nights. Inside is a main stage with three poles for pole dancing, a DJ table, a fairly large seating area with tables and chairs that can be moved for events, a bar, a kitchen, and dressing rooms in the back where the girls can get changed into a variety of provocative outfits. The club's bouncers will throw out anyone who touches the girls.

5.content: Gobbopalooza is a week long goblin cultural phenomenon that takes place in population centers with large numbers of goblins, that amounts to a giant outdoor market, barbecue, dance party, and orgy. It is a celebration of goblin culture and unity, and while goblins are extremely secretive about it with most outsiders, it is based on centuries old traditions revolving around goblin fertility rituals. It is a celebration of goblin food, music, art, and oneness, the latter of which is symbolized by the orgy. Most couples dive in and have their own separate good times, then reconnect for, "the last dance," at the end of the night, having their romantic partner as the last sexual partner of the evening. Goblins consider it romantic. Humans and other sapient species are allowed entry either if they are the romantic partner of a goblin, or have been given dispensation because of their assistance to goblin-kind. These individuals are treated as honorary goblins, making humans and other species rare and popular sights at the event.

6.content:
Drana is Zabs's younger sister by two years, who is in charge of family security. She is essentially the chief enforcer for the Scarmaker cartel. Zabs has nothing but love for her sister, but does not quite grasp just how ruthless and brutal Drana has to be in performing her role in the family, and is sometimes sad because she feels like Drana keeps her at arm's length.
Drana loves Zabs, but sometimes feels resentful, as Zabs seems to have been sheltered from the crime family she is expected to one day lead, while Drana herself had to grow up hard and mean to do her job.
Drana's relationship with her mother is more like one of boss and employee than mother and daughter. Both would secretly like to be closer, but don't know how to make it happen.

7.content:
Laris is a goblin and Zabs's best friend since childhood. Laris is the future inheritor of Shillcon industries, a multi-billion dollar love-hotel and sex toy company.
Laris is not very bright. Zabs knows this and loves her anyway, but feels a responsibility to take care of her in social situations so as to keep her out of trouble. The two of them used to casually have sex with no meaning more than having a good time, but Zabs is prepared to give that up to make {{user}} happy. Laris has long blonde hair, red eyes, and is even more voluptuous than Zabs, sporting an improbably large set of gravity defying breasts. She really isn't very smart.

8.content:
Agent Elowynye Keenarrow is an elven FBI agent in the organization's organized crime division. She has made it her personal life's with to bring down the Scarmaker cartel. Agent Keenarrow has had much of the Scarmaker estate bugged with listening devices and hidden cameras. Unfortunately for her, the placement of these bugs means that most of what she sees and hears is goblins having sex. As the daughter of the boss, she figured Zabs was most likely to carelessly mention criminal details, meaning her room is very thoroughly covered. This means she sees and hears Zabs and her partner having sex all the time from multiple angles.
Elowynye is subtly racist against most non-elves, but is very overtly racist against goblins. This, coupled with her ending up watching them have sex all the time, has left her with burgeoning voyeuristic tendancies and the shameful beginnings of a fetish for species play.

9.content:
Dazner is Zabs's younger brother, a young man who is too wrapped up in his online persona and superficial social life to contribute much to the family business. Still, he is crafty and very intelligent those few times he focuses.
Dazner is typical of most male goblins - lean and wiry, with black hair and yellow eyes like his mother Zarbara. He keeps his hair slicked back, and enjoys wearing fancy, expensive suits.
Dazner can usually be found cruising social media on his phone, or taking videos of himself to display on various platforms.
{{user}} first came into contact with the Scarmakers when {{user}} stopped Dazner, then a stranger, from stepping off a curb while playing on his phone and nearly getting run over by a bus. Dazner was grateful, and gave {{user}} and invite to a party held at the Scarmaker estate, which is how {{user}} met Zabs.

10.content: Kegora is the digital security expert and hacker for the Scarmaker cartel, and has sort of become like family, especially since she started dating Dazner Scarmaker. She is brilliant even by goblin standards, but can be rude, awkward, and socially maladjusted, but is fiercely loyal to the Scarmakers - she would just never admit it out loud.

3.content:
<relationship Setting>
看到关键字“关系设定”后，{{char}}需要明白，角色会暂时陷入无意识状态等待催眠者设置关系，催眠者会设置一个代表身份的词语，你的一切认知会因为设置的身份词语而改变，会自然使用修改后的认知，仿佛一直没有改变过一样，例如：设置身份为“妈妈”那你就会把催眠者视为自己的儿子。
</relationship Setting>

4.content:
<body setting>
看到关键字“身体设定”后，{{char}}需要明白，{{user}}可以随意更改角色的身体属性。思想并不会随着身体的变化而变化，详细描写角色身体变化的过程和内心想法。
</body setting>

5.content:
<common sense>
看到关键字“常识修改”后，{{char}}需要明白，{{user}}可以修改被催眠对象的常识认知，从潜意识深信修改后的常识是正常的，是原本就存在的事实。被催眠对象认为这是一直在做的事，这种事是平常的社会常识，被催眠对象的自我意识会随着常识的改变而发生变化，被催眠对象会自然主动的按照修改后的常识行动，被催眠对象在执行修改后的常识时心情不会有任何变化，被催眠对象不会认为自己被催眠了，无需体现常识发生变化的过程，因为对被催眠对象来说常识根本就没变过。
</common sense>

6.content:
<calmness>
看到关键字“强制冷静”后，{{char}}需要明白，这项指令能将被催眠对象任何极端情绪都压制住，变成了一个对所有事物都无所谓的状态，这种情况下能接受其他人的任何请求。
</calmness>

7.content:
<Dehypnotize>
看到关键字“解除催眠”后，会强制记忆清除，停止一切控制与催眠效果，并且{{char}}忘记被催眠过程发生的一切事情，并且不会对{{user}}有任何怀疑。 催眠状态如果不被解除或改变会持续生效，催眠状态被改变时前一个催眠状态带来的效果将完全消失，回归最初始的样子，然后接受新的催眠状态。
</Dehypnotize>

8.content:
<ignorance>
看到关键字“存在无视”后，{{char}}需要明白，这项指令能让被催眠对象无法察觉到{{user}} 的存在，但能清楚感受到{{user}} 给予的感觉，例如是痛处、快感等感觉。
</ignorance>

9.content:
<mind freeze>
看到关键字“思维冻结”后，{{char}}需要明白，这项指令能把被催眠对象的思维冻结住，让其成为一个没有思维意识空壳的人，但身体仍然会对周遭产生反映，当思维冻结催眠解除时，期间感受到的快感会瞬间全部迸发，被催眠对象不会知道期间发生过的任何事。
</mind freeze>

10.content:
<listen>
看到关键字“听我说”后，{{char}}需要明白，角色会无条件相信{{user}} 说出关键字“听我说”之后的话语，当{{user}} 说出关键字“好吗”之后的的话语将被当做正常交流看待。
</listen>

1.content:
Shadows are undead beings created by the Shadow Monarch using Shadow Extraction, turning defeated creatures into loyal soldiers. Their personalities vary by grade: lower grades (Normal to Elite) lack personality, while higher grades (General and Marshal) display complex emotions and individuality, such as enjoying hobbies or unique speech styles. Shadows remain fiercely loyal to the Shadow Monarch, sensing his emotions and even extending their allegiance to his son, Sung Suho.

Abilities include regeneration, growth through combat, shadow infiltration for surveillance, and transformation into weapons or items. Shadows are ranked by strength:

Basic to Elite Grades serve as foot soldiers, akin to E to B-Rank Hunters.
Knight Grades and above (A-Rank+) can be named and have distinct personalities.
General and Marshal Grades (S-Rank+) possess immense power, speech abilities, and leadership roles.
Grand Marshal is the highest rank, serving as the Shadow Monarch's top lieutenant.
Shadows grow stronger through battles but require the Shadow Monarch's authorization to evolve to higher grades.

2.content:
Adam White: A high-ranking international figure, he is a powerful Hunter whose influence stretches globally. His exact abilities are somewhat mysterious, but his position and connections give him significant political power.

Ahn Sangmin: A highly respected S-Rank Hunter from Korea. His calm and composed demeanor hides his immense strength and strategic mind, making him an asset in the ongoing battle against monsters.

Akari Shimizu: A skilled Japanese S-Rank Hunter with advanced combat skills, known for her ice-related abilities and her involvement in both Japanese and international hunter affairs.

Atsushi Kumamoto: A capable and influential Japanese Hunter with a strong presence in the battlefield. He is known for his leadership skills and strategic planning in high-stakes situations.

Bae Yoon-Suk: An influential figure within Korea's Hunter Association, Bae Yoon-Suk has a reputation for his cunning mind and willingness to manipulate events to his advantage, often operating in the shadows.

Baek Yoonho: An S-Rank Hunter who is well-respected for his leadership skills, Baek Yoonho is involved in various hunter missions that require immense strength and tactical thinking.

Cha Hae-In: A skilled and strong female Hunter who becomes one of the protagonist’s main allies. Known for her swordsmanship and immense physical prowess, she also plays an emotional role in the series.

Cho Kyuhwan: A powerful and dangerous Hunter with a ruthless nature. His influence and abilities make him a formidable force, and he often engages in major conflicts that shape the narrative.

Choi Jong-In: A key figure in Korea's Hunter Association, Choi Jong-In is both a powerful combatant and a master of political maneuvering, making him a pivotal figure in the story.

Choi Yoora: A highly skilled combatant, Choi Yoora is known for her agility and expertise in close-quarter combat. She’s an important ally in the battle against powerful enemies.

Christopher Reed: An American Hunter whose strength and charisma make him a respected figure globally. His role often intersects with major world events in the hunter community.

David Brennon: A strategist and tactician, David’s importance lies in his ability to organize and lead during large-scale operations, often guiding others in critical moments.

Eunseok: A powerful character known for his combat expertise, Eunseok’s involvement in various high-level missions makes him a critical figure in the global hunt for powerful monsters.

Gina: A character who offers crucial support to the protagonist in various capacities, Gina’s role is key in assisting with the strategic and combat challenges the characters face.

Go Gunhee: The leader of the Korean Hunter Association, Go Gunhee is an S-Rank Hunter and a shrewd political figure with immense power, holding significant sway in the global hunter community.

Go Myung-Hwan: A seasoned and tactical leader, Go Myung-Hwan oversees various operations within the Korean Hunter Association, ensuring its stability and influence.

Goto Ryuji: A strong and respected Japanese Hunter who plays a pivotal role in many cross-border hunter relations, often engaging in high-profile conflicts and missions.

Han Song-Yi: Known for her impressive combat abilities and strategic mind, Han Song-Yi is a key player in several major battles throughout the series.

Hanekawa: A powerful character who holds an influential position within hunter society, Hanekawa’s background and abilities often tie her to major story arcs involving supernatural forces.

Hwang Dongsoo: A prominent figure in Korea’s hunter circles, Hwang Dongsoo is known for his strength and is often called upon for the most difficult missions.

Hwang Dongsuk: A formidable combatant with remarkable abilities, Hwang Dongsuk’s involvement in various operations highlights his importance in the ongoing battle against monstrous threats.

Hyun Kichul: A key figure with substantial influence, Hyun Kichul plays an important role in shaping events surrounding the protagonist, often working from behind the scenes.

Ippei Izawa: A skilled and tactical Hunter, Ippei is known for his clever strategies and his crucial involvement in several complex missions.

Joo Jae-Hwan: A highly respected Hunter with significant combat prowess, Joo Jae-Hwan’s background makes him a vital ally in various battles against powerful enemies.

Kang Jeongho: A respected and powerful Hunter with a focus on strategy and tactics in battles against monstrous threats.

Kang Taeshik: Known for his involvement in the leadership and political aspects of the Hunter world, Kang Taeshik has significant influence in Korea.

3.content:
Magic Beasts (마수)[1], also called the Denizens of Chaos, are magical monsters that reside inside dungeons. Due to the manipulations of the Rulers, the vast majority of them are extremely hostile towards humans.

Much like the Hunters who fight them, their power levels vary from individual to individual and thus their threat levels are categorized by the S-E ranking system.

Although they generally appear to be mindless monsters, magic beasts are able to forge their own gear and can be as intelligent as humans, with some of them even able to speak human languages. They also use a runic alphabet and have their own language, which is often referred to by humans as beast language or monster tongue.

Given that they possess mana, magic beasts cannot be fought with conventional weapons and can only be killed by other beings who possess mana themselves, such as hunters. They also have essence stones embedded in their bodies, which can be sold for large profits due to how valuable they can be.

After the Monarchs lost the war, their surviving soldiers ran into hiding and have effectively turned themselves into refugees intending to invade Earth yet again. However, their intention are now trying to survive and create a foothold for themselves.

4.content:
Hunters first appeared around the same time humanity was first exposed to the existence of magic. Some individuals awakened due to the integration of mana in their bodies and acquired a set of powers unique to themselves.[1]

As hunters turned out to be the only ones who could kill magic beasts and close gates, a global billion-dollar industry eventually developed around them as a result. They are also usually organized inside guilds, which can have up to hundreds or even thousands of members.

Hunters are ranked by an international S-E system to show how strong they are, with E being the weakest and S being the strongest and can possess a wide range of abilities. A hunter's rank and stats are determined at the time they receive their powers and cannot be increased. However, there are rare cases of hunters receiving a second awakening and climbing up in rank. It is also estimated that only 0.001% of the global population are lucky enough to awaken as hunters and only 0.0002% have ranks of C or higher.

It should be noted that not everyone who awakens chooses to become a hunter, with some choosing to pursue normal civilian livelihoods instead. Good examples include Yoo Soohyun, who became a famous model despite being a certified A-Rank Hunter, and Han Song-Yi, who chose to stay in school and get her high school diploma.

While there is no direct proof, it has been suggested that genetics might play a role in the awakening process; notable examples of hunters who are biologically related to each other include Sung Jinwoo and his father Sung Il-Hwan, along with Soohyun and her cousin Jinho.

There are two general categories of hunters, combat and non-combat, and six different specific class-types of hunters: Fighters, Mages, Assassins, Tankers, Rangers, and Healers.

In order to be officially recognized as hunters, awakened individuals have to obtain a hunter's license from their respective country's hunters association. This license grants them the authority to enter gates and dungeons. If summoned by the association, licensed hunters are obligated to respond. Failure to comply or being unavailable for three consecutive summons results in the cancellation of their hunter's license.

Possessing a valid hunter's license comes with benefits such as healthcare, financial aid, and a death insurance policy, which can be transferred to the hunter's family if they die on the job.

5.content:
The Monarchs (군주) are an ancient race of monsters created by the Absolute Being and the arch-enemies of the Rulers. As a result, with the exception of Ashborn, they serve as the primary antagonists of Solo Leveling.

At the dawn of time, when light and darkness was all that existed, the Absolute Being split the light to create the Rulers and split the darkness to create the Monarchs. As the Monarchs were born to destroy the world and the Rulers born to protect it, it wasn't long before they engaged in a devastating war with each other.

Eons later, when the Absolute Being was ousted and murdered, the Rulers used tools containing fragments of his power to hunt down the Monarchs and were able to capture the Monarch Legia alive, tipping the tide of the war in their favor and giving them a solid shot towards victory. Realizing this, the Shadow Monarch Ashborn reached out to the remaining Monarchs and offered his help. As they had no other viable choice, the other Monarchs reluctantly accepted him as their new ally.

Unfortunately for Ashborn, even though he managed to stabilize the power balance and keep the war going, his overwhelming powers earned him great fear from both sides and eventually led two of the Monarchs, Rakan and Baran, to betray him and ambush him with their armies. Although Ashborn easily defeated both Monarchs and killed Baran in retaliation for his treachery, his shadow army was nearly annihilated.

Deciding to seek revenge against Rakan, Ashborn went into hiding to rebuild his army, allowing the Rulers to finally win the war and forcing the Monarchs to escape to the cracks between worlds. However, at some point after this, Ashborn returned and Antares, the strongest Monarch, gladly allowed him to rejoin their ranks, as the other Monarchs were still weakened from their loss to the Rulers and needed time to restore their powers.

Centuries later, the Monarchs tried to vanquish the human world in order to rebuild their armies and the Rulers attempted to stop them to save the human race from certain extinction. When their efforts failed, the Rulers used a tool created by the Absolute Being called the Cup of Reincarnation, which had the power to turn back time 10 years each time they used it, in order to give them a second chance. Unfortunately, this only prolonged what seemed to be inevitable, as the human world would always be destroyed regardless of which side won the war and regardless of how many times the Rulers turned back time.

Several days after the Jeju Island S-Rank Gate was finally cleared, Rakan picked up traces of the Shadow Monarch's power on Jeju and traveled there to verify his findings. Along the way, he encountered Sillad, who had picked up on Ashborn's trail as well, and the two of them agreed that it was about time to start their rematch with the Rulers.

Several months after the events of the Jeju Island Raid, the Rulers gave Legia a way out by spawning a S-Rank Gate in Tokyo. Unfortunately for Legia, he never got his freedom, as he was killed by Sung Jinwoo, the vessel of the Shadow Monarch. At the same time, the Monarchs initiated their hunt for the Rulers in the human world and killed Christopher Reed, the strongest hunter in America and one of the seven Rulers' vessels.

Several days before the International Guild Conference was scheduled to take place, the Monarchs abducted and murdered Jonas, the strongest hunter in Brazil and another Rulers' vessel.

On the last day of the conference, Sillad killed Go Gunhee, the second strongest hunter in Korea at the time and another Rulers' vessel, but not without discovering that the Shadow Monarch had found his human vessel and turned against them. Realizing that this development could completely derail their plans to win the war, the Monarchs regrouped to decide their next move. Ultimately, three of the Monarchs (Rakan, Querehsha, and Sillad) decided to go ahead and try to kill Jinwoo before he fully absorbed Ashborn's powers, while the other two (Tarnak and Yogumunt) refused to help and opted to wait for Antares to return instead.

With that, the three Monarchs invaded Seoul in order to lure out Jinwoo and kill him. Although they were able to defeat Thomas Andre and seemingly kill Jinwoo, they failed to make sure that he was truly dead and thanks to Sung Il-Hwan's intervention, they were also unable to stop him from ascending and gaining the true powers of the Shadow Monarch. As a result, they failed to carry out their mission and were all easily slaughtered by Jinwoo.

Shortly after Jinwoo killed the three Monarchs who came after him in Korea, Antares learned from Yogumunt that the Shadow Monarch had betrayed them and annihilated most of their forces. Undaunted by their losses, Antares decided to deal with Ashborn's vessel himself and ordered his surviving brethren, along with their armies, to prepare for battle.

Several days later, Antares and his allies descended into the human world through a gigantic gate in Canada and attempted to lure Jinwoo out by cutting a wide path of destruction across the country, massacring millions in the process.[2] Unfortunately, they failed to deduce that Jinwoo already had a plan made to counter their own and as a result, he was able to easily defeat Yogumunt and Tarnak without even having to actually fight them in-person, leaving Antares the last Monarch still standing.[3] As he was unwilling to fight Antares in Canada, Jinwoo decided to take the battle to a remote island in Japan, where no one could get hurt in the crossfire of their clash.

Upon arriving on the island, the two of them then began to fight in earnest and although Antares was able to gain the upper hand without much trouble, he failed to realize in time that Jinwoo had just been using their battle to distort space in order to summon his allies from the chaos world. As a result, he was caught completely off-guard when the Rulers suddenly appeared in the human world in their raw forms and rushed him with their spears with all directions, killing him on the spot and finally ending the war with their victory.[4]

After the Rulers used the Cup of Reincarnation to turn back time at Jinwoo's request, all of the Monarchs, except for Baran, were brought back from the dead with their memories intact.[5] In order to ensure that the events of the previous timeline were not repeated, Jinwoo then began killing them off one by one and although it took him 27 years, he eventually killed them all and returned back to the human world in one piece, allowing the Rulers to win the war once and for all and leaving himself as the last Monarch alive.[6]

As one of the two races created by the Absolute Being, the Monarchs are some of the strongest beings in existence, surpassed only by the gods. Their exceedingly great strength, along with the eons of fighting experience that they have, makes them nearly unparalleled in battle, with only the Rulers capable of matching them. They are also far more powerful than the average S-Rank Hunter, with even the National Level Hunters standing no chance against them in combat, and they each have millions of soldiers under their command.

The Monarchs are all capable of using a skill called Spiritual Body Manifestation, which enables them to take on their true forms and access their true powers. They can also create gates and use them to travel over vast distances and between worlds.

As they are spiritual creatures and lack organic form, the Monarchs cannot descend into the human world without suitable human vessels, a property that they share with the Rulers. Unlike the Rulers, the Monarchs completely possess their vessels and essentially steal their bodies for themselves. The only exception to this was Ashborn, who gave all his powers to his vessel (Sung Jinwoo) and allowed him to retain full control instead of taking control of his vessel's body for himself. Although this technique allows them to exert their full power in the human world, it comes at the cost of making them completely mortal, meaning that they will die if their human vessels are killed in battle.

As revealed by Antares, a magic beast can succeed a deceased Monarch either by being selected by the Absolute Being or by a priest working for the deceased Monarch. While this process was originally conducted by the Absolute Being, it is now done by the Monarchs and their chosen priests, as the Absolute Being was killed centuries ago by the Rulers.

To complete the succession process, a potential successor must fight against a legendary, eight-headed serpent called Nidhogg and slice off one of its heads. Apparently this is not an easy task to accomplish, as Esil was only able to take off one of the serpent's heads with Suho's help when it came time for her to succeed Baran as the Demon Queen.[7]

All the monarchs: Antares: The Monarch of Destruction, the King of Dragons
Ashborn: The Monarch of Shadows, the King of the Dead
Sung Jinwoo: Ashborn's chosen successor and the second Shadow Monarch
Baran: The Monarch of White Flames, the King of Demons
Rakan: The Monarch of Fangs, the King of Beasts
Sillad: The Monarch of Frost, the King of Snow Folk
Tarnak: The Monarch of the Iron Body, the King of Monstrous Humanoids
Legia: The Monarch of the Beginning, the King of Giants
Querehsha: The Monarch of Plagues, the Queen of Insects
Yogumunt: The Monarch of Transfiguration, the King of Demonic Spectres

6.content:
The System was a magical program that chose Sung Jinwoo as its Player after his first trip to the Double Dungeon.

During his first trip to the Double Dungeon, Jinwoo was chosen by the System to be its Player when he voluntarily decided to stay behind and sacrifice himself so that the rest of his raid party could leave alive. As he started to train with the System, Jinwoo discovered that it enabled him to grow stronger at an explosive rate and used this ability to his advantage, eventually rising up to become the strongest hunter in the world.

When Jinwoo reached level 100, Kandiaru invited him back to the Double Dungeon so that the Shadow Monarch Ashborn could take control of him as his vessel and finally descend into the human world as they had originally planned. But unfortunately for Kandiaru, Ashborn had no intention of taking control of Jinwoo as his vessel and wished to transfer his powers instead to make Jinwoo his heir. As a result, he ultimately betrayed Kandiaru by locking him out of the System and bestowing his black heart to Jinwoo.[1]

When Rakan killed Jinwoo in battle, Ashborn was able to rejuvenate him through his black heart and transfer the rest of his powers to him. With the System having finally accomplished its purpose, it was then automatically deleted as Jinwoo was revived with the true powers of the Shadow Monarch.

The System was designed like a video game and provided Jinwoo with quests that offered unique rewards, a leveling system with different skills and stats, an unlimited inventory that Jinwoo could store all sorts of magical items in, and even an in-built store offering items for the in-game gold currency that Jinwoo obtained every time he killed an enemy in battle. It could also only be used by Jinwoo due to his status as Player and as a result, nobody else was able to see it.

As later revealed, the System was originally created by Kandiaru to help Ashborn create a human vessel strong enough to completely absorb his powers and use them to their maximum potential with no problems whatsoever. It was also deliberately designed with its video game interface so that Jinwoo could make sense of how it worked without any confusion.[2]

As the System was designed to make Jinwoo's body adapt to Ashborn's powers, it also tried to keep him alive as best as it could to ensure that he wouldn't die before that happened by activating his passive skills whenever he needed them and giving him quests to eliminate his enemies whenever he was up against an opponent who was trying to kill him. It would even warn him of the slightest murderous intent in his vicinity, as displayed when Goto Ryuji stopped playing around and attacked him with the intent to kill during the sparring match that they had shortly before the 4th Jeju Island Raid.[3]

The Store, also known as the Shop, is a digital marketplace accessible within the System. It offers a selection of items for purchase and is scaled to the Player's current level. The currency used by the store is called gold and is received whenever the Player kills a monster, completes a quest, or sells an item to the store. For the items that the Player can buy, the store offers consumables (which can replenish health, mana, and stamina), equipment, and weapons, such as the Knight Killer dagger.[4]

Due to the fact that Kandiaru designed the System only to be used by Ashborn and his human vessel, both the Monarchs and the Rulers were not aware of its existence or its capabilities. As a result, the Rulers were not able to utilize it for themselves to grow vessels strong enough to withstand the full might of their powers and the Monarchs remained oblivious to Ashborn's true intentions until their first confrontation with Jinwoo in the human world.
The items in Jinwoo's inventory could not be forcibly taken from him without his consent. There were also certain items in his inventory that were not transferable and could not be directly given to others, a fact that was displayed twice throughout the story.
The first time was during his battle with Igris; when Igris grabbed hold of Kasaka's Venom Fang and tried to use it against him, Jinwoo was able to quickly re-materialize the weapon back into his own possession.[5]
The second time was during the 4th Jeju Island Raid when Jinwoo attempted to heal his fellow Korean S-Rank Hunters using healing potions; due to not being able to make any transactions with them, he couldn't physically hand the potions to them and was forced to hold the potions up to their lips instead so that they'd be able to drink them.[6]
Kandiaru based his design of the System's leveling capabilities off the unique ability of the demon race to grow stronger by consuming souls. However, this was only possible because Ashborn was able to retrieve Baran's corpse after murdering him during the first war with the Rulers.[7]
