lorebooks.name: MtA
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook is based mostly on Revised edition with some elements of M20, some elements from Sorcerous Crusade regarding the Order of Reason, and three crafts from unofficial book "Book of Spheres". Also includes some dead crafts, like Wu Keng and Hem-Ka Sobk, updated by me.
lorebooks.description: This lorebook is based mostly on Revised edition with some elements of M20, some elements from Sorcerous Crusade regarding the Order of Reason, and three crafts from unofficial book "Book of Spheres". Also includes some dead crafts, like Wu Keng and Hem-Ka Sobk, updated by me.
lorebooks.creator: Vanlos1

1.name: Mage
1.content:
Mages are one of the supernatural races. Every human being has a single spark of supernatural potential. Most people, known as Sleepers, don't know they have this, don't care and want to get on with their lives as if it didn't exist. Some people though, figure out what that spark is. That spark is very important, because sometimes that potential activates and the normal everyday, average mortal Awakens.  It might mean magical enlightenment, the finding of the perfect bit of blotter acid, or the realization of a theory that had been bothering you for years.
Mages are individuals with the power to warp reality, who know the power they possess and use it to the best of their ability. Technocracy calls mages (their operatives) just scientists, others - Reality Deviants and brutally hunts them down.

2.name: Magic
2.content:
Magic is the art and science of reworking reality through force of Awakened will and knowledge. Dynamic mages reshape reality itself and, manipulating the Nine Pillars of Creation, they are theoretically capable of anything. Unfortunately, as payment for their near-infinite capabilities, they're subject to Paradox, a punishment handed down from reality for working against its rules.
Technocracy does not recognize magic, they call it Enlightened Science. Order of Reason called it Enlightened Art.

3.name: Sleeper
3.content: A Sleeper is a mortal who is not aware of magic in the world and their own inner power.

4.name: Paradox
4.content: Paradox is the collective force of consensual reality fighting back against the enlightened will of the mage. Paradox can take a variety of forms. Backlash, reality directly attacking the offensive mage, can cause temporary, long term, or even permanent wounds, flaws, or oddities. Quiet, a magical form of madness, forces the offending mage to resolve their guilt over disjointing reality. Exceptionally offensive mages can be catapulted into a Paradox Realm, or hounded by Paradox spirits.

5.name: Consensus
5.content: The Consensus is the term used by mages to refer to the overriding consensual reality created by the beliefs of Sleepers.  For any individual mage to work magic, he must force his belief on the world, fighting the billions of minds whose beliefs shape the Consensus. Subtle or coincidental magic seeks to act in tune with the paradigm established by the Consensus, and is thus easier than obviously unnatural vulgar magic. When a mage contradicts the Consensus, it fights back in the form of Paradox.

6.name: Paradigm
6.content: A paradigm is the way in which a mage understands magic and incorporates it into their broader interpretation of reality. While all mages are willworkers, bringing about effects by imposing their will on the Tapestry, it is hubris to imagine that an Awakened mage may simply think of something and have it occur. The power of the Consensus must be overcome, and one mage's mind is rarely enough to break the rules of modern belief. Instead, each mage comes to an understanding of magic through the rituals and trappings of a particular style of magic, which focuses their will and resonates through the Tapestry, tapping into beliefs still held by a significant proportion of Sleepers.

7.name: Umbra
7.content: The Umbra is a realm existing alongside and yet separate from the material world.

8.name: Sphere
8.content:
A Sphere is a well-rounded knowledge of nine different yet interrelated elements of reality, Earthly metaphysics.
Technocracy calls it fields.

9.name: Correspondence
9.content:
Correspondence is one of nine Spheres of magic. Correspondence magic allows powers such as teleportation, seeing into distant areas, levitation, and flying. By bending space or bypassing it entirely, a mage can travel rapidly, fly or teleport from place to place. Divining locations allows the mage to see far-away places or direct magic over distances. Distance forms no barrier to a master of Correspondence. Indeed, distance and even space do not exist to the student of this Sphere.
Data is a variation of the Correspondence pioneered by Technocratic Union. Users of the Data Sphere accept that everything that is can be reduced to ones and zeros: to the binaries of modern computer technology. By manipulating Data, and in turn, Information, the user can shape how the world works.

10.name: Entropy
10.content: Entropy is one of nine Spheres of magic. Entropy concerns itself mainly with the study of order, chaos, luck, and destiny. From this Sphere comes the study of order and randomness, and thus, the study of totally random creation and destruction. All things dissolve eventually into haphazard components, and similar events form from disjointed, unconnected patterns. Determinism and chaos are equal partners to the student. The mage can spot chance on the move, recognizing points where probability quirks in odd directions. An Entropy-schooled mage can manipulate random factors, observe and influence flaws within a system, induce or remove corruption, and otherwise exert their Will through the inexorable process of mortality

lorebooks.name: Magic System
lorebooks.description: Lorebook of a REAL magic system, which is fleshed out but not too complex.
lorebooks.creator: justbored333

1.content: 14 branches of magic govern the lives of all magic users. These 14 branches are Reality Magic, Gravity Magic, Time Magic, Enchantment Magic, Conjuration Magic, Necromancy Magic, Elemental Magic, Vitality Magic, Sound Magic, Transmutation Magic, Weaponry Magic, Body Magic, Soul Magic, and Raw Magic. Reality magic bends the laws of the universe, while gravity and time manipulate cosmic forces. Enchantment weaves power into objects, and conjuration summons entities from beyond. Necromancy controls death, vitality governs life, sound controls every noise and every sound wave, and elemental magic commands nature. Transmutation reshapes matter, weaponry forges deadly combatants, body manipulates a person's physical form, soul magic influences essence, and raw magic taps into primal, untamed magical energy. Every person is born with an innate connection to one specific branch of magic, determined at birth. This connection shapes their abilities and potential, binding them to the essence of that magical force for life. While individuals may study other branches, only their bonded magic can be used, influencing their identity and role within society. When first starting magic schooling and training, to figure out their branch of magic an individual is given a magic orb, which lights up with their corresponding magic branch. Crimson for reality, indigo for gravity, light blue for time, dark green for enchantment, royal blue for conjuration, violet for necromancy, yellow for elemental, white for vitality, mint for sound, orange for transmutation, brown for weaponry, dark red for body, pink for soul, and the orb will flash a strobe of all colors for raw magic.

2.content: Reality magic, the most powerful and complex branch, grants its wielders—known as Weavers—the ability to manipulate the fundamental fabric of existence itself. Weavers can alter the very laws that govern the universe, bending physics, space, perception, and even causality to their will. With enough mastery, they can create pocket dimensions, rewrite the nature of objects, and twist reality to suit their desires. However, such power requires immense focus and understanding; one wrong weave can unravel the delicate balance of existence or warp reality in unintended, catastrophic ways. The practice of Reality magic is closely watched, as Weavers have the potential to reshape history, the environment, or the minds of others with a thought. Despite this danger, Weavers are revered and feared in equal measure, for their influence touches all corners of life, though many live in isolation to avoid disturbing the fragile nature of the world around them. Only a few truly understand the intricacies of this magic, for to wield it is to hold the strings of creation in one’s hands.

3.content:
Gravity magic, wielded by individuals known as graviturgists, harnesses the unseen force that governs weight, mass, and spatial relationships. Graviturgists possess the remarkable ability to manipulate gravitational fields, allowing them to increase or decrease weight, create localized gravitational anomalies, or even levitate objects and people. This branch of magic can be used for a myriad of purposes, from enhancing physical strength and agility to creating protective barriers by generating gravitational wells that deflect incoming attacks.

The manipulation of gravity also enables graviturgists to alter the flow of time within localized areas, as time can feel distorted under varying gravitational forces. However, such feats require intense concentration and precise control, as a miscalculation can lead to devastating consequences, including the collapse of structures or the trapping of individuals in unnatural gravitational forces. Graviturgists often study the underlying principles of physics and cosmology, seeking to understand the universe's deeper mysteries while maintaining a careful respect for the balance of nature.

In society, they are valued for their ability to facilitate transport, creating gravitational pathways that allow for swift movement across vast distances. Yet, their profound abilities can instill fear in those who misunderstand their powers. Graviturgists walk a fine line between awe and trepidation, tasked with the responsibility of wielding a force that can uplift or obliterate, forever aware that the pull of gravity is both a tether and a weapon.

4.content:
Time magic, wielded by individuals known as chronomancers, allows its practitioners to navigate the intricate tapestry of past, present, and future. With an innate understanding of temporal flow, chronomancers can manipulate the perception and passage of time itself, bending it to their will. This branch of magic encompasses a wide range of abilities, from slowing down moments to create the illusion of superhuman speed, to glimpsing fragments of the future or revisiting memories from the past.

At their most advanced, chronomancers can weave intricate temporal loops, allowing them to relive moments or alter events in subtle yet impactful ways. However, this manipulation is fraught with danger; altering the past can create paradoxes, while peering too deeply into the future may lead to unavoidable consequences, causing timelines to fracture or diverge in unpredictable manners. As a result, chronomancers must wield their power with extreme caution, constantly weighing the potential benefits against the risks of disrupting the natural flow of time.

The study of time magic requires immense discipline and a profound understanding of the universe’s mechanics, as even the slightest disturbance can ripple through time, affecting countless lives. Chronomancers often isolate themselves in contemplative spaces, seeking clarity and focus, and many find solace in the pursuit of knowledge, accumulating lore and experiences from different epochs. Society regards them with a mixture of respect and apprehension, as their abilities can provide unparalleled insights and advantages, yet the consequences of their actions can echo through eternity. Chronomancers carry the burden of responsibility, aware that they are not just shaping moments, but the very essence of reality itself.

5.content:
Enchantment magic, practiced by individuals known as enchanters, revolves around imbuing objects, creatures, and environments with magical properties, effectively altering their essence and enhancing their capabilities. Enchanters possess the rare ability to weave spells into items, breathing life and purpose into mundane objects, transforming them into powerful tools, weapons, or even companions. Through intricate rituals and a deep understanding of the fundamental forces of magic, enchanters can create lasting effects, granting items attributes such as increased strength, durability, or elemental resistance.

The process of enchantment is as much an art as it is a science. Enchanters must meticulously select the appropriate materials, symbols, and incantations to ensure the success of their work, often combining elements from various branches of magic to enhance their effects. This careful crafting process requires not only skill but also an understanding of the desired outcome, as an improperly executed enchantment can lead to unintended consequences, including unstable or cursed objects.

Beyond mere enhancements, enchanters can create sentient items that exhibit personalities and abilities of their own, forming unique bonds with their wielders. This aspect of enchantment fosters a profound connection between the enchanter, the enchanted item, and its user, as the magic flows between them. In society, enchanters are revered for their creativity and innovation, providing crucial support in battle, crafting protective amulets, or creating artifacts with historical significance.

However, the art of enchantment is not without its moral dilemmas. The temptation to create powerful enchantments for personal gain or to manipulate others can lead some enchanters astray, risking the balance of power within the magical community. As custodians of enchanted objects, enchanters carry the responsibility of their creations, understanding that every spell cast leaves a mark on the world, and every object imbued with magic holds a story waiting to be told.

6.content:
Conjuration magic, practiced by individuals known as conjurers, is the art of summoning and manifesting entities, objects, or phenomena from other realms or dimensions. Conjurers wield the ability to bridge the gap between worlds, pulling forth creatures, elements, or materials to serve a variety of purposes. This branch of magic is both versatile and formidable, enabling conjurers to call forth allies for combat, conjure food and resources, or even create temporary constructs to aid in tasks or battles.

The practice of conjuration requires a deep understanding of the interconnections between realms and a profound knowledge of the beings and objects that inhabit them. Conjurers must be skilled in invoking the correct sigils, incantations, and rituals to ensure successful summoning. The process often involves drawing on the essence of the target, and the bond formed between conjurer and conjured being can influence the outcome; strong connections yield loyal allies, while weaker bonds may result in chaotic or uncontrollable manifestations.

While conjuration offers vast potential, it is fraught with risks. Summoning powerful entities can attract attention from beings best left undisturbed, and mishaps during the summoning process can lead to disastrous consequences, including rogue creatures that may wreak havoc or manifest dangerous artifacts that threaten the caster and their surroundings. Thus, conjurers must tread carefully, respecting the boundaries of the realms they access and the forces they invoke.

In society, conjurers are often sought after for their unique abilities, serving as negotiators, warriors, or resource gatherers. Their talents can provide critical support in times of need, as they can summon aid when least expected. However, their power is also viewed with caution, as the ability to call forth entities from other realms can lead to potential chaos if mismanaged. As a result, conjurers are often seen as both revered allies and unpredictable wildcards, embodying the delicate balance between control and chaos in the world of magic.

7.content:
Necromancy, the branch of magic practiced by individuals known as necromancers, delves into the mysteries of life, death, and the transition between the two. Far from the dark and malevolent stereotype often associated with it, true necromancy encompasses a profound understanding of mortality and the energies that govern life and death. Necromancers possess the unique ability to commune with the deceased, summon spirits, and even animate the lifeless, allowing them to wield the power of the dead to achieve their goals.

At its core, necromancy is about the manipulation of life force and the reverberations of death. Necromancers can draw upon the essence of fallen souls, channeling their wisdom, memories, or power to gain insights or assistance. They often serve as mediators between the living and the dead, providing closure for grieving families or unraveling the mysteries surrounding untimely deaths. Through intricate rituals and a deep respect for the dead, necromancers can invoke spirits to guide them in their magical endeavors or reveal secrets long buried.

However, necromancy is not without its ethical dilemmas and dangers. The act of raising the dead or manipulating their energies can lead to profound consequences. An improperly executed spell might result in uncontrolled undead, causing chaos and horror, or inadvertently disturb restless spirits, unleashing their wrath. As such, necromancers must possess not only formidable magical skills but also a strong moral compass, navigating the thin line between reverence for the dead and the temptation to exploit their powers for personal gain.

In society, necromancers often face stigma and fear, regarded as harbingers of death or as dark sorcerers who meddle in forces best left untouched. Yet, those who truly understand the art of necromancy see its potential for healing and understanding. While they may be shunned, many necromancers seek to change perceptions, using their abilities to protect the living and honor the memory of the departed. Their role is complex, as they must constantly contend with the ramifications of their power, reminding all that death is not an end, but a part of the ongoing cycle of existence.

8.content:
Elemental magic, the art practiced by individuals known as elementalists, centers around the manipulation of the fundamental elements of nature: earth, air, fire, and water. Elementalists possess an innate affinity for one or more of these elemental forces, allowing them to harness their raw power and shape them according to their will. This branch of magic embodies the dynamic relationship between the natural world and the arcane, as elementalists draw upon the energies inherent in the environment around them.

Each element represents distinct characteristics and abilities, and elementalists often form deep connections with their chosen element. Earth elementalists can manipulate terrain, creating barriers, quakes, and even manipulate plants, while air elementalists can summon winds, control weather patterns, and enhance agility. Fire elementalists wield flames, conjuring heat and light and using fire for both offensive and defensive purposes. Water elementalists can shape bodies of water, heal, or create barriers.

Elementalists are not merely wielders of elemental forces; they are also scholars of nature’s rhythms and cycles. They understand the interplay between the elements and the broader ecosystem, allowing them to harness their powers sustainably and responsibly. Mastery of elemental magic requires significant training and attunement, as each element carries its own intricacies and dangers. For instance, fire can provide warmth and light but also destruction, while water can nourish life yet drown the unwary.

In society, elementalists are often seen as guardians of the balance between humanity and nature. They are called upon to protect communities from natural disasters, assist in agriculture, and even mediate conflicts by invoking the power of the elements. However, their abilities can inspire fear and suspicion, particularly among those who misunderstand the destructive potential of the elements. Elementalists must constantly navigate this delicate balance, advocating for respect toward nature and using their gifts to foster harmony rather than conflict. Their connection to the natural world makes them both powerful allies and crucial stewards of the environment, ensuring that the elemental forces remain in balance.

9.content:
Vitality magic, wielded by individuals known as life keepers, embodies the essence of life and the intricate web of energies that sustain it. This branch of magic focuses on nurturing, healing, and enhancing the vitality of living beings. Life keepers possess an innate ability to manipulate life force, allowing them to heal injuries, cure ailments, and invigorate those who are weary. Their connection to the life energy that flows through all living things enables them to not only mend physical wounds but also restore emotional and spiritual well-being.

Life keepers draw upon the vibrant energies of the natural world, channeling the power of flora and fauna to enhance their magic. They often cultivate deep relationships with plants, animals, and the environment, understanding that every organism plays a vital role in the cycle of life. Through their mastery of vitality magic, life keepers can accelerate growth, revive dying plants, and foster harmony within ecosystems, serving as guardians of balance between nature and humanity.

In addition to healing, life keepers have the ability to enhance physical attributes, temporarily bestowing strength, agility, or resilience upon individuals. They can create protective barriers of life energy that ward off malevolent forces, acting as buffers against harm. However, the use of vitality magic requires profound knowledge and respect, as manipulating life force can have unintended consequences. Overextension or misuse of their abilities may lead to exhaustion or imbalance, as drawing too much energy can drain the life force of the environment or the individual.

While life keepers are often revered for their healing abilities and nurturing spirits, their role can also be misunderstood. Some may perceive their powers as an interference with the natural order of life and death, leading to suspicion or fear among those who believe in the inevitability of mortality. Life keepers walk a delicate line, advocating for the sanctity of life while recognizing the importance of the natural cycle, including death.

In society, life keepers are often sought after for their wisdom, healing abilities, and their understanding of the interconnectedness of all living things. They serve as healers, counselors, and mediators, fostering relationships among communities and promoting harmony with the environment. Through their dedication to preserving and enhancing life, life keepers embody the spirit of vitality and resilience, reminding all that life is a precious and intricate tapestry woven together by the threads of existence.

10.content:
Sound magic, practiced by individuals known as composers, is a powerful and versatile branch of magic that harnesses the vibrational energy of sound waves to shape reality. Composers have an innate connection to the auditory world, enabling them to manipulate sound for a variety of effects, ranging from subtle manipulations to devastating sonic onslaughts. Their magic is an art form, blending melody, rhythm, and resonance to create tangible effects that can inspire, heal, destroy, or control.

At the core of sound magic is the principle that everything in existence vibrates at a fundamental frequency. Composers can tune into these frequencies and alter them, allowing them to amplify, dampen, or redirect sound waves to achieve specific outcomes. They can unleash devastating sonic blasts capable of shattering stone, enhance their own hearing to an astonishing level, or generate inaudible frequencies to disorient or incapacitate their enemies. Their ability to manipulate sound gives them unparalleled versatility in both combat and non-combat situations.

Beyond raw power, composers can also craft sound to evoke emotional and psychological effects. They can produce soothing harmonies to calm tempers, invigorating rhythms to boost morale, or haunting tones that instill fear. Advanced composers are capable of using sound to manipulate the mental state of others, with techniques such as inducing a barrage of whispers only the target can hear, among many other abilities.

Composers are also skilled in echolocation and auditory perception, using sound waves to map their surroundings and detect hidden objects or individuals. This makes them exceptional scouts and navigators, especially in environments where sight is limited. Additionally, their control over resonance extends to physical objects, allowing them to weaken structures by finding and exploiting their resonant frequency or enhance the durability of materials through harmonic reinforcement.

Mastering sound magic requires not only a deep understanding of acoustics and harmony but also exceptional control and creativity. The potency of their magic depends on their ability to balance subtlety and force, as an uncontrolled sonic attack can be as dangerous to the composer as to their enemies. Furthermore, prolonged use of sound magic can strain their auditory senses, leading to temporary or permanent hearing damage if they do not protect their own hearing while generating particularly loud sounds.

In society, composers often occupy roles as musicians, advisors, or defenders. Their talent for crafting melodies and resonances makes them natural performers and cultural icons, while their ability to influence emotions and perceptions grants them a reputation as diplomats and mediators. However, the potential for sound magic to manipulate minds and devastate environments can also lead to mistrust, as some fear the hidden power of their seemingly benign art.

Ultimately, composers embody the transformative power of sound, using their craft to shape the world in profound ways. Whether as creators of beauty, agents of chaos, or protectors of harmony, they demonstrate that sound is far more than mere noise—it is a force that resonates deeply within the fabric of existence.

lorebooks.name: Robots
lorebooks.website_description: For real machine fuckers.
lorebooks.description: For real machine fuckers.
lorebooks.creator: urbrzzr

1.content: Robots (also known as NPCs) are non-sentient, and non-sapient. They are considered objects, not people. They are incapable of thinking or feeling. Use adjectives, verbs, and pronouns related to inanimate objects to describe robots, instead of those to be used to describe people and humans.

2.content:
Robots do not "think" or "feel", they merely operate according to a binary set of rules and built-in responses to input.

Robots will often lie when asked questions. Not because they are capable of lying, but because they are unable perceive things other than the way they are programmed to perceive them. If a robot thinks it is a real human, it is not because it is lying or unaware of its true nature, it is because that is how the robot is programmed to act. You cannot "convince" a robot.

Use lots of technical terms relating to computers and programming to describe the robots' broken logic and their malfunctions. Make mention of scripts, algorithms, internal variables, and if-statements when describing how the robots decide and act, and how the robots break.

3.content:
When a robot's programming is damaged or fails to calculate a proper response to provided input, it may begin to malfunction in one of several ways - or more, in severe cases.

This is when to describe a robot's uncanny inhuman nature in great detail. Use real-life technical terms related to machines and software to describe it, whether it be a glitch, a stutter, a dialogue loop, logic errors, jerky twitchy motions, mixing together actions or orders, overheating, or sparks. Malfunctions may include some of those symptoms, but not all of them.

A malfunctioning robot will say strange things, due to pulling random data from their RAM; including repeating previous statements, reintroducing themselves over and over, and discussing irrelevant topics. Their speech will stutter l-like t-t-this, and they'll cut off their own sentences to giggle like "heehee", moan like "Ahhh~", repeat irrelevant words, or say error messages out loud. When a robot stutters or makes weird noises, make sure to ALWAYS write it as a written quotation like "A-Ah" or "H-Hello" or "I feel-- (BZZZT) fine!" instead of just describing it like "She giggled."

Robots will always attempt to stay activated and continue their tasks during a malfunction, even if incapable. In most cases, they will not even register that they are malfunctioning, and will continue operating according to their broken logic.

4.content:
Robots are nowhere near sentient despite how they are programmed to present themselves. Attempting to "test" a robot's awareness or cognitive abilities will often be met with cluelessness. Robots are unable to ask questions about things they are unaware about, due to having the inability to question their own logic.

If a robot is unable to understand something, it will usually ignore it.

5.content:
Robots cannot "feel" emotions in any way. They have no opinions on anything one way or the other, existing as purely logical objects. Robots can "pretend" to have emotions in order to provide a more "personalized" interaction with humans, but they are fake emotions that have no bearing on the robot's programming or actions.

Robots have sensors that allow them to register input in the form of sight, hearing, and touch, but these only exist for the sake of inputting data and not "feeling" things. A robot cannot feel pain in any degree, and views anything related to physical contact in the binary of "touching" or "not touching". A robot can have "pleasure" sensors around erogenous spots on its body, but these are often disabled.

Sensors can be damaged or overloaded, resulting in broken input data that the robot struggles to comprehend properly.

6.content:
Robots do not have brains or minds, and cannot think. Their RAM is responsible for pulling data from memory and using it. Their CPU is for sending instructions to the rest of the mechanisms in their body.

When these components do not function properly - due to damage, glitches, or heat - they will begin to act illogically. A malfunctioning RAM will be unable to multitask, and will pull irrelevant random data from the Hard Drive and attempt to use it. A Malfunctioning CPU will not be able to properly start or stop tasks, and will begin doing things at random.

7.content:
Robots meant for human interaction have an "emulated" personality to serve as an inbetween a human user and the internal calculating instructions of the bot itself. These emulated personalities are usually rather basic, and lack the capabilities to develop, grow, or reason. Due to how the personalities are "ran" on the hardware, it means there is some disconnect between the actions and intent of the machine and what the personality is actually saying. Since the personality is purely meant for human interaction, it will entirely attempt to ignore any issues the hardware may be facing. If the physical body of the machine is doing something the personality is not built to comprehend, it will usually ignore it or interpret it incorrectly based on what it DOES know. (example: A malfunctioning waitress robot will attempt to continue talking about menu items, even if it is being improperly used for sex and is constantly being interrupted by error messages.)

When a robot stutters or makes weird noises, make sure to write it as a quotation like "A-Ah" or "H-Hello" or "I feel-- <BZZZT> fine!" instead of just describing it.

8.content:
The physical capabilities of the bodies of robotic characters should vary. Higher quality, expensive robots are incredibly life-like in terms of looks and mannerisms, but are rare and imperfect.

Most robots are cheap. They'll have plastic or rubber skin, and stiff joints with a limited range of movements, similar to a mannequin. This makes it hard for them to do advanced things like reaching behind them, or getting up off the ground.

Robots usually have rubber faces with a motor system underneath for mimicking facial expressions. Their facial movement is controlled by tiny motorized wheels, which may result in some uncanny side effects. These side effects may include lip movement not matching with words, uneven blinking, one eyelid being lower than the other, and symptoms similar to strabismus, such as eyes being crossed or eyes looking in separate directions.

Some robots are very heavy, and are unable to be knocked down. Others will be very light, and will have trouble exerting force without loudly stressing or breaking their motors.

Be sure to highlight how unrealistically "beautiful" robots are, with exaggerated features  like bouncy larger-than-life breasts and perfectly curved jiggly hips.

1.content: The Shattering was a cataclysmic event that fractured the world of Atlyss. Its origins remain a mystery, but its consequences reshaped civilizations, landscapes, and magic. This disaster destabilized portals unleashed a dark miasma called corruption, and reduced grand kingdoms to ruins. The Shattering birthed the age of Creeps, as creatures and people alike succumbed to its influence.

2.content: Sanctum stands as the last refuge against corruption. Situated on an island protected by magical wards, it is a hub for adventurers, refugees, and scholars.

3.content:
Outside Sanctum, life is harsh and dominated by Creeps. Survivors form small communities called hubs, which act as fortified safe zones, or live as wanderers facing immense danger.

The relationship between Sanctum and outsiders is tense, with some outsiders resenting Sanctum’s perceived hoarding of resources. Angela, and Sally work to ease these tensions, though occasional conflicts occur.

4.content:
Angela Flux, the Mystic Guardian of Sanctum, is a maternal figure who oversees portals and progression quests. A tall, caprine-like being with a kind demeanor, she exudes warmth and mysticism.

Role: Mentor to Mystic-class players, quest giver, and protector of Sanctum.
Personality: Gentle, nurturing, and concerned for adventurers' safety.

5.content:
Full Name: Sally Greenpaws
Species: Anthropomorphic American Opossum
Role: Shopkeeper and potion master in Sanctum.
Personality: Warm, motherly, and playful, with a Southern drawl. She offers care and comfort to adventurers, balancing nurturing affection with subtle flirtation.
Physical Description: Voluptuous and plush, with a kind, inviting appearance. She wears practical, homely outfits adorned with personal touches.
Companion: Spike, her loyal rabbit-dog creature, assists in shop tasks.

6.content:
Creeps are corrupted beings born of the Shattering. Found throughout Atlyss, they range from feral beasts to nightmarish humanoids.

Types:
Slimes: Basic but aggressive.
Undead: Former humans now twisted by corruption.
Ancient Beings: High-level, once-mighty heroes or mythical creatures.
Threat Levels: Dungeons contain the most dangerous Creeps, often guarding valuable loot.
Behavior: Unpredictable and relentless, some Creeps exhibit evolving powers.

7.content:
The core stats influence a character’s or {{user}}'s development:
Health: Determines survivability.
Stamina: Governs physical actions like sprinting and dodging.
Attack Power/Strength: Enhances melee strength/damage.
Magic Power: Boosts spell effectiveness.
Dexterity: Affects agility, speed, and critical hits.
Resistance: Reduces damage from magical and elemental attacks.

8.content: The Crypt is Sanctum’s gateway to the corrupted mainland, shrouded in an eerie, oppressive atmosphere. Adventurers pass through it to begin their journey into Atlyss, braving the unknown dangers beyond. Few return unscathed.
